description:
- fixed a drum fill (bar 179)
- added a james lead guitar track
- added some let rings (intro, interlude and outro)
- fixed some little details in the nylon guitar theme
- fixed some details in the pre and post-interlude distorted guitar theme
- switched the volume swells from bass to clean guitar (as it is in the official ajfa songbook)
- fixed james part in the interlude by removing all the hammer-ons that aren't in the song after the first bar
title: To Live Is To Die

description: the bpm increased to 106 1 bar early, so i fixed that
title: To Live Is To Die

description:
- Changes to Acoustic Theme
- Fixed Outro to match the song
Here's a link to an even more bass heavier version of TLITD just in case anyone wants to tab out the bass better or check if it's correct: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XPGRZ4THL3w
title: To Live Is To Die

description:
- Improved bass on interlude
Here is a bass heavier version of the song: https://youtu.be/yCK_NCuoULs?t=3404
(This is a rough mix from 1988-1989 before the studio release, so it's the official bass track don't worry about that)
title: To Live Is To Die

description: Fixed the tempo slowdown being 1 bar too short in the very end of the song
title: To Live Is To Die

description: Changed the acoustic guitar sound to an acoustic guitar.
title: To Live Is To Die

description:
1. I added a ton of missed palm mutes to the main riff.
2. I changed some of the tabs to the same notes, but much simpler and easier to play. They make more sense the other way as well.
3. The intro and outro acoustic guitar had a very subtle hammer on and pull off, so I added that.
4. When I downloaded the GP file, there were a bunch of notes that songsterr didn't have because of the missing functionality, so I manually reprogrammed those notes.
5. Changed the sound effect of the swelling bass to a cello, as that is what most people seem to identify it as at first.
6. Added some more descriptive text.
7. Added some more dead notes that would be played if picked.
title: To Live Is To Die
